drupalNodeEvent.title: Negotiations on Investment Facilitation for Development at the WTO

field_speakers.processed:
• Kei Tomaru (Permanent Mission of Japan to the International Organizations in Geneva)
  • Karl P. Sauvant, (Columbia Center on Sustainable Investment (CCSI) & Columbia Law School)

field_organizers.processed: U.S.-Asia Law Institute at NYU School of Law and the APEC Study Center at Columbia University

field_description.processed: At the World Trade Organization (WTO), over 110 countries and regions are currently negotiating over investment facilitation for development. The aim is to facilitate foreign direct investment by improving the transparency and efficiency of investment measures and encouraging sustainable investment. This plurilateral initiative is essential to strengthen the rule-making function of the WTO. Kei Tomaru, who as second secretary at the Permanent Mission of Japan in Geneva represents one of the leading countries in the negotiations, and Karl P. Sauvant, resident senior fellow at the Columbia Center on Sustainable Investment, who closely follows these negotiations, will share their views about the negotiationâ€™s importance and prospects.
